intro: Mosannona pachiteae, commonly known as the Pachitea tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
